intro: Valeriana macbridei, commonly known as the Philippine valerian, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
